STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 3, 2024
Jennifer LYNN Shores
SAGINAW COUNTY DHHS
411 E GENESEE AVE,
SAGINAW, MI, 48607-1254
RE: License#: CP730201395
Dear Jennifer LYNN Shores:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/28/2024 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency interim inspection was completed 7/8/2023. There was one
noncompliance with Rule 405(4) regarding the timely completion of change in
placement documentation. The CAP for this noncompliance was approved
12/15/2023 by DCWL. This was not identified in noncompliance during the current
renewal evaluation. No areas were identified in noncompliance as a part of the
current renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. Identified barriers in
completing the CAP were that both child welfare program managers resigned
within hours of each other during the licensing period. They have also had foster
care and placement workers out on FMLA so there was concern that with these
changes some information may get overlooked through the process. The staff is
also continuing to work at becoming knowledgeable with the CWLM system. The
staff has utilized the share drive in the process of successfully completing the
approved CAP.
Financial Overview
Not applicable.
Staff Interviews
The child welfare staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff
interviews did not indicate any areas of concern other than those related to the
staff turnover.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.

9/2/2024

Mark Hunter Date
